column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of CeOBiS2-xSex with x = 0, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, and 1.0 were\rprepared by a solid-state reaction method.
#Text=Powders of Bi2S3 and Bi2Se3 were pre-synthesized by\rsintering a mixture of grains of Bi (99.999%), S (99.99%), and Se (99.999%) in an evacuated\rquartz tube at 700 ºC for 15 h.

#Text=Powders of Ce2S3 (99.9%), CeO2 (99.99%), Bi2O3 (99.999%),\rBi2S3, Bi2Se3 and Bi (99.999%) grains with a nominal composition of the target phases (x = 0–\r1.0) were mixed, pressed into a pellet, sealed into an evacuated quartz tube, and heated at 700 ºC\rfor 5 h.
#Text=The obtained sample was ground, mixed, pelletized, and heated for 5 h at different\rtemperature.
#Text=Samples heated at 400 ºC were labelled S1 and samples heated at 700 ºC were\rlabelled S2.
#Text=S1 samples contained fewer impurities than S2 samples, but it was too fragile to\rmeasure electrical resistivity with four proves.
#Text=Therefore, S1 was used for structural analysis, and\rS2 was used for electrical resistivity and magnetization measurements.
